intro: Dalechampia smilacina, commonly known as the creeping dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a vine or shrub, characterized by its opposite, simple leaves and showy, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its propagation.
